lead_paragraph: Researchers say they have figured out a piece of the puzzle of why a 2.3 million-gallon spill of molasses from a storage tank in Boston was so deadly, killing 21 people and destroying buildings.

headline.print_headline: Solving Mystery of the 1919 ‘Tsunami of Molasses’
headline.main: Solving a Mystery Behind the Deadly ‘Tsunami of Molasses’ of 1919

snippet: Researchers say they have figured out a piece of the puzzle of why a 2.3 million-gallon spill of molasses from a storage tank in Boston was so deadly, killing 21 people and destroying buildings....
abstract: Researchers from Harvard University present research on explosion of holding tank in Boston in 1919 that resulted in destructive flood of molasses that killed 21 people; session at American Physical Society meeting, led by Prof Shmuel M Rubinstein and advised by fluid dynamics expert Nicole Sharp, explains why 2.3 million gallon wave of molasses, which some reports said was up to 40 feet tall, was so deadly.
